title: 2020 Annual Report
body: BioHarvest reported $16.8M revenue from early produce sales. Demonstrated PhytoCell lettuce, attracting media and investor interest. ESG initiative: water recycling program piloted. Risks: scalability and energy costs.

title: 2021 Annual Report
body: Revenue $34.1M, Nestlé licensing signed. Business model expanded toward IP licensing. ESG: rural farming empowerment programs.

title: 2022 Annual Report
body: Revenue $62.4M, FDA GRAS granted for Nutrivine additive allowing commercial US sales. Risks: adoption rate of novel foods. ESG: solar expansion in vertical farming.

title: 2023 Annual Report
body: Revenue $94.8M, Coca‑Cola partnership signed. Strong growth in IP licensing. Margins pressured by energy prices. ESG: zero‑deforestation pledge.

title: 2024 Annual Report
body: Revenue $119.2M despite high energy risks, PPAs signed stabilized future exposures. Scaling biotech farms. ESG: equal gender hiring reached 50%. Risks: volatility in energy and food regulation.

title: PhytoCell Lettuce Demo
body: BioHarvest showcased first edible leafy crop produced via PhytoCell tech inside vertical farm. Coverage gained from media worldwide.

title: Nestlé Licensing Deal
body: Signed agreement with Nestlé licensing PhytoCell actives for nutraceutical markets. Provided annual royalty streams and milestone payments.

title: FDA GRAS Approval
body: Food additive Nutrivine cell-grown wine enhancer approved as GRAS by FDA, unlocking US commercialization.

title: Coca‑Cola Ingredient Supply
body: Multi‑year agreement to supply cell‑derived phytonutrients into Coca‑Cola wellness beverages. Initial $20M deal value.

title: Energy Cost Spike
body: High electricity prices hit vertical farms. Q1 margins lowered by 200bps. Management accelerated renewable PPAs.

title: Solar PPAs Signed
body: Company contracted multiple solar suppliers in Israel, Spain, and US to stabilize farm energy costs long‑term.

title: Bayer Global JV
body: JV with Bayer CropScience to advance precision traits and cell‑agriculture platform. Future licensing and product collaborations expected.

title: Q2 2025 Earnings
body: Reported record revenues of $21.8M Q2 from Nestlé, Coca‑Cola, and farm produce. EPS 0.49. Guidance raised for FY.
